revised_title: The Influence of Food and Exercise on Earthy and Alkaline Phosphates in Urine
tldr: The author investigates the effects of food and exercise on the levels of earthy and alkaline phosphates in urine. The study finds that earthy phosphates increase after meals, while alkaline phosphates are influenced by both food and exercise. The research also suggests that certain dietary substances, such as chloride of calcium, can affect phosphate levels in urine.
